taxonomicnotes: Rita kuturnee was originally described as Phractocephalus kuturnee by Sykes (1839) from Bhima river, Maharashtra. Subsequently, Valenciennes described Arius hastatus (Cuvier and Valenciennes 1840), which is now considered as a synonym of Rita kuturnee (Jayaram 1966, Ferraris 2007).
rationale: Rita kuturnee is expected to be widely distributed in central India and there is no information on population trends or wide spread threats to the species. The species is therefore assessed as Least Concern. However, the population of this species in upper reaches of Krishna river has declined drastically and the species is possible threatened by urbanization, pollution and heavy harvesting. If such population trends are reported from other parts of its distribution, the species may qualify for a threatened category.
